actions.committee: House Committee on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.
Resolution Agreed to in House (Amended) by Yea-Nay Vote: 403 - 17 (Record Vote No: 169).
Received in the Senate, and referred to the Committee on Banking.

committees.committee: House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs
Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress with respect to monetary policy, inflation and high interest rates.

summary.text: (Measure passed House, amended, roll call #169 (403-17)) Expresses the sense of Congress that the administration should: (1) take immediate action to reduce the future budget deficit and so permit lower interest rates; (2) encourage the banking system to concentrate available credit on those uses which contribute most to long-term productivity improvement and inflation fighting; and (3) encourage the Federal Reserve to lower interest rates without jeopardizing firm control over the aggregate rate of growth of money and credit.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of the Congress with respect to monetary policy, inflation and high interest rates.
